forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Partly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West wind around 18 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. West northwest wind 6 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As twilight descends upon Downtown San Francisco, the air carries both the promise of rain and whispers of the day’s fading warmth. The skyline appears wrapped in a mysterious shroud, as shadows gather around familiar outlines. This afternoon, the city’s high strayed around 56, but the vigor of the west wind—whipping at 18 mph—brings a palpable chill, nudging temperatures to a more temperate 54. Today’s journey revealed the specter of rain—a 70% chance clinging to the horizon, with the forecast hinting at just a sprinkle, less than a tenth of an inch, if fortune and clouds align.

As evening drapes its cool cloak, the chance of precipitation wanes to a slight 20%. The remnants of a fading marine layer linger, perhaps painting the edges of the view with a hazy gray. Should one venture outdoors, layers become an ally; a comfortable jacket over a light sweater could keep the evening chill at bay. A brisk walk through the streets, perhaps pausing at a cozy café for a warming cup of tea, would be a lovely pursuit as day surrenders to night. For those whose spirits lean toward the indoor, maybe a leisurely book by a window would suit, as the soft rumble of rain gently nudges one into a thoughtful reverie.
